verses.text: After the plague, the Lord spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
verses.comment: Sets the context after the plague (cf. Numbers 25:9).

verses.text: "Take a census of all the congregation of the people of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers' houses, all in Israel who are able to go to war."
verses.comment: Repeats the command from the first census (Numbers 1:2-3).

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.comment: Geographic context: on the edge of entering Canaan.

verses.text: "Take a census, from twenty years old and upward," as the Lord had commanded Moses. The people of Israel who came out of the land of Egypt were:
verses.comment: Emphasizes the continuity from the Exodus.

verses.text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel. The sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the clan of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;
verses.comment: Tribal genealogy references Genesis 46.

verses.text: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.
These are the clans of the Reubenites, and those listed were 43,730.
verses.comment: A slight change in census numbers from the first census.

verses.text: And the son of Pallu: Eliab.

The sons of Eliab: Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram. These are the Dathan and Abiram, chosen from the congregation, who contended against Moses and Aaron in the company of Korah, when they contended against the Lord,
verses.comment: Historical note on the rebellion.

verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, when the fire devoured 250 men, and they became a warning.
verses.comment: Describes the judgment at Korah's rebellion.

verses.text: But the sons of Korah did not die.
verses.comment: Korah's sons survived; they become known for psalms later.

verses.text: The sons of Simeon by their clans: of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the clan of the Jachinites;
verses.comment: Names and clan groupings align with earlier genealogies.

verses.text: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the clan of the Shaulites.
These are the clans of the Simeonites, 22,200.
verses.comment: Note the significant decrease from the first census.

verses.text: The sons of Gad by their clans: of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;
of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;
verses.comment: Ozni also called Ezbon in Gen. 46:16.

verses.text: of Arodi, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites.
These are the clans of the sons of Gad; as those listed, 40,500.
The sons of Judah were Er and Onan; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.comment: Historical note referencing Genesis 38.

verses.text: And the sons of Judah by their clans were: of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.
And the sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.
These are the clans of Judah as those listed, 76,500.
verses.comment: Judah remains the largest tribe.

verses.text: The sons of Issachar by their clans: of Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Puvaites;
verses.comment: Puvah also called Puah.

verses.text: of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.
verses.comment: Jashub called Job in Gen. 46:13.

verses.text: These are the clans of Issachar as those listed, 64,300.
The sons of Zebulun by their clans: of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.
These are the clans of the Zebulunites, as those listed, 60,500.
The sons of Joseph according to their clans: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.comment: Joseph's tribe is divided into his two sons.

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the clan of the Machirites; and Machir begot Gilead; of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.
verses.comment: Manasseh’s line is traced through Machir and Gilead.

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;
of Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; of Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;
of Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; of Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.
Now Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, had no sons, but only daughters. The names of Zelophehad’s daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.comment: Significant for inheritance law in later chapters.

verses.text: These are the clans of Manasseh. As those listed, 52,700.
verses.comment: Population increase since the first census.

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim by their clans: of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the clan of the Becherites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.
And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the clan of the Eranites.
These are the clans of the sons of Ephraim as those listed, 32,500. These are the sons of Joseph by their clans.
The sons of Benjamin by their clans: of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;
verses.comment: Ahiram called Ehi in Gen. 46:21.

verses.text: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.
verses.comment: Shephupham is Shuppim in 1 Chron. 7:12; Hupham is Huppim.

verses.text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamites.
verses.comment: See also Genesis 46:21.

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin by their clans, as those listed, 45,600.
These are the sons of Dan by their clans: of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. These are the clans of Dan by their clans.
verses.comment: Shuham called Hushim in Genesis 46:23.

verses.text: All the clans of the Shuhamites, as listed, were 64,400.
The sons of Asher by their clans: of Imnah, the clan of the Imnahites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriites.
verses.comment: Ishvi called Jesui in Genesis 46:17.

verses.text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the clan of the Malchielites.
The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.comment: Serah is notable as a named daughter.

verses.text: These are the clans of the sons of Asher as those listed, 53,400.
The sons of Naphtali by their clans: of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;
of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.
verses.comment: Shillem called Shallum in Genesis 46:24.

verses.text: These are the clans of Naphtali according to their clans, as those listed, 45,400.
This was the number of the people of Israel: 601,730.
verses.comment: Total population after the plague, compared to the first census.

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Sets up the following instructions for land allotment.

verses.text: "Among these, the land shall be divided for inheritance according to the number of names.
verses.comment: Inheritance based on census numbers.

verses.text: To a larger tribe you shall give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller tribe you shall give a smaller inheritance; every tribe shall be given its inheritance in proportion to those listed in the census.
But the land shall be divided by lot. They shall receive their inheritance according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.
verses.comment: Allotment by lot, with tribal boundaries.

verses.text: Their inheritance shall be divided by lot, large and small, according to the number of the names.
verses.comment: Emphasizes fairness and chance by lot.

verses.text: This was the list of the Levites by their clans: of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
verses.comment: Levites are counted separately.

verses.text: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. And Kohath fathered Amram.
verses.comment: Genealogical details for the Levites.

verses.text: And the name of Amram's wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt. She bore to Amram: Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
And to Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
But Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord.
verses.comment: Explains why Nadab and Abihu are not counted.

verses.text: And those listed were 23,000, every male from a month old and upward. For they were not listed among the people of Israel because there was no inheritance given to them among the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Levites were given no land inheritance.

verses.text: These are those who were listed by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who listed the people of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
But among these there was not one man of those listed by Moses and Aaron the priest, who listed the people of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.comment: None of the original generation remained.

verses.text: For the Lord had said of them, "They shall surely die in the wilderness"; and not one of them was left, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.comment: Confirms God’s judgment was fulfilled.
